meta.description: The family of a health worker who died six days after getting the Covid-19 vaccine is seeking a ban on the vaccine, however, the Gurugram CMO has said that it would be incorrect to connect the death with vaccine until post-mortem report it out.

title: Gurugram health worker dies 6 days after Covid-19 shot, family seeks ban on vaccine
cleaned_text:
By Kumar Kunal: A health worker in Haryana’s Gurugram died on Friday, six days after she was given the first shot of the Covid-19 vaccine. Rajwanti, a 55-year-old health worker posted at the PHC Center in Bhangraula, was among the first to get the Covid-19 vaccine shot on Saturday, January 16.

Over 130 hours later, in the wee hours of Friday morning, she died at her home. According to reports, Rajwanti’s family said that she did not wake up in the morning and was brought dead at the Medanta hospital. She did not have any reaction to the vaccine on the day it was administered, they said.

However, now the family is seeking a ban on the vaccine. Rajwanti’s son has filed an FIR at New Colony police station in Gurugram against the vaccine.

But Gurgaon's Chief Medical Officer Dr Virendra Yadav has said that it would be incorrect to relate Rajwanti’s death with vaccine until her post-mortem report is out.

Dr Virendra Yadav told India Today TV that the matter was being investigated seriously.

India has so far vaccinated over 10 lakh people with the first dose of either of the two Covid-19 vaccines Covishield, developed by Oxford and AstraZeneca, and Bharat Biotech’s Covaxin. According to Union health ministry data, a few 100 beneficiaries have exhibited adverse events following vaccination but none of the deaths reported after the vaccination have been linked to the jab.

opengraph.title: Gurugram health worker dies 6 days after Covid-19 shot, family seeks ban on vaccine
